titleInfo.title: Controlling oscillatory behaviour of a two neuron recurrent neural network using inputs

name.namePart: International Conference on Artificial Neural Networks (ICANN 2001)

mods.abstract: We derive analytical expressions of codim-1-bifurcations for a fully connected, additive two-neuron network with sigmoidal activations, where the two external inputs are regarded as bifurcation parameters. The obtained Neimark-Sacker bifurcation curve encloses a region in input space with stable oscillatory behaviour, in which it is possible to control the oscillation frequency by adjusting the inputs.

bibliographicCitation.wels: Haschke, R.; Steil, J. J.; Ritter, H. (2001): Controlling oscillatory behaviour of a two neuron recurrent neural network using inputs. In: Georg Dorffner; Horst Bischof; Kurt Hornik (Hrsg.): Artificial Neural Networks - ICANN 2001. Springer. (Lecture notes in computer science, 2130). S. 1109-1114.
